title: (x) Telstra Telecom corporate face - Harmony (custom font by Jeremy Tankard) {Tim D, Yves}
content:
I really like this... The lowercase e is really nice too.

[http://www.telstra.com.au/business/products/mobiles/phonesanddevices/ind...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307095938/http:/www.telstra.com.au/business/products/mobiles/phonesanddevices/index.htm "http://www.telstra.com.au/business/products/mobiles/phonesanddevices/index.htm")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307095938im_/http:/typophile.com/files/telstra_6087.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307095938im_/http:/typophile.com/files/telstra1_5394.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307095938im_/http:/typophile.com/files/telstra2_5997.gif)

Thanks for helping a brotha out,

Mikey :o)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: Mikey, you should know better than to post type identifications in the General Discussions forum! Moved it to the proper forum.

[http://www.typography.net/commissions/telstra.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307095938/http:/www.typography.net/commissions/telstra.htm "http://www.typography.net/commissions/telstra.htm")

Corporate, commissioned from Jeremy Tankard

Tim
Designed by [Jeremy Tankard](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307095938/http:/www.typography.net/commissions/telstra.htm) BTW. I knew it felt British.

Tim thank you!

Yves thank you!

Look at my time stamp. I posted at 3:00am where I live... I think I'm allowed a little insanity at this hour! AHAHAHA!

Mikey :o)
